attributes.action: To tax Portsmouth Football Club like any other Bussiness
attributes.additional_details:
In Prime-ministers questions 1/2/2012     1214: Tory Penny Mordaunt urges the PM to tell HM Revenue and Customs to meet Portsmouth FC to discuss how to keep the club afloat. Mr Cameron promises to do all he can to keep the club afloat.
WHY?

I cannot believe a Conserative MP and PM take this view.

They have had 80% of thier tax written off by the courts before and again failed to income tax and VAT on time.

We formally ask the treasurary to collect all taxes due from this business in a time of austerity.
